dublinCore.title: 113 HR 2857 IH: Disaster Loan Fairness Act of 2013

action.action-desc: Mr. Barletta introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Small Business, and in addition to the Committee on House Administration, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the Small Business Act to provide the interest rate for certain disaster related loans, and for other purposes.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Disaster Loan Fairness Act of 2013 .

section.header: Interest rate for certain disaster related loans
section.text: Section 7(d) of the Small Business Act is amended by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: Upon application, the Administration shall grant an interest rate determined under this paragraph with respect to any qualifying disaster loan.
For the purposes of this paragraph a qualifying disaster loan is the Administration’s share of a loan—

clause.text: for which the interest rate would be set pursuant to paragraph (5) but for the operation of this paragraph;
which is or was made with respect to activity in an area when the President has declared a major disaster in that area under section 401 of the Stafford Act; and
which is or was made 30 days after the date of the enactment of this paragraph or later.

subparagraph.text: The Administrator shall determine the interest rate for each calendar year to be the lesser of—

clause.text: a rate equivalent to 1/2 the rate prevailing in the private market for similar loans for those unable to attain credit elsewhere and 3/4 of that prevailing rate for those able to attain credit elsewhere.

subparagraph.text: Not later than one year after the date of the enactment of the Disaster Loan Fairness Act of 2013 , the Administrator shall report to Congress as part of the annual report under section 10(a) on whether the interest rate provided by this paragraph has resulted in any or all of the following:

clause.text: A greater number of applications for disaster related loans.
A greater number of approvals of disaster related loans.
A decreased default rate on disaster related loans.

section.header: Termination of use of public funds for political party nominating conventions
section.text: Section 9008 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Termination of use of funds for conventions
subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, in the case of any Presidential election held after 2012—

paragraph.text: on November 1 of the year prior to the year in which the election is held, the Secretary shall determine—

subparagraph.text: in the case of the first such election, the amount which is equal to the aggregate amount of the payments which were made under subsection (b)(3) to the national committees of a major party or minor party for the Presidential election held in 2012, adjusted in the manner described in subsection (b)(5), or
in the case of any subsequent election, the amount which is equal to the amount determined under subparagraph (A), adjusted in the manner described in subsection (b)(5); and

paragraph.text: at the time the Secretary makes the determination under paragraph (2), an amount equal to the amount determined under paragraph (2) shall be permanently rescinded from the fund and returned to the general fund.
